channel.title: CVE Feed for reputeinfosystems -- Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder
channel.description: The latest CVEs for reputeinfosystems -- Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder

item.title: CVE-2023-6828|2024-08-02T08:42:07.724Z -- reputeinfosystems -- contact%20form%2C%20survey%20%26%20popup%20form%20plugin%20for%20wordpress%20%E2%80%93%20%20arforms%20form%20builder
item.description: The Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘ arf_http_referrer_url’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 1.5.8 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1945|2024-06-04T18:00:03.859Z -- reputeinfosystems -- contact%20form%2C%20survey%20%26%20popup%20form%20plugin%20for%20wordpress%20%E2%80%93%20%20arforms%20form%20builder
item.description: The Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized loss of data due to a missing capability check on the 'arflite_remove_preview_data' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and above, to delete arbitrary site options, resulting in loss of availability.

item.title: CVE-2024-1945|2024-08-01T18:56:22.314Z -- reputeinfosystems -- contact%20form%2C%20survey%20%26%20popup%20form%20plugin%20for%20wordpress%20%E2%80%93%20%20arforms%20form%20builder
item.description: The Contact Form, Survey & Popup Form Plugin for WordPress – ARForms Form Builder plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to unauthorized loss of data due to a missing capability check on the 'arflite_remove_preview_data' function in all versions up to, and including, 1.6.4. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with subscriber access and above, to delete arbitrary site options, resulting in loss of availability.
